content:
• Wednesday, March 6, 2013

  • More on PetSmart: Q4 comes in mixed, beating on its bottom line but coming up slightly shy on...

    More on PetSmart: Q4 comes in mixed, beating on its bottom line but coming up slightly shy on revenue. Net profit jumped 31% Y/Y as the specialty pet store's same-store sales and margins continued to grow. However, the company predicts downbeat results for 2013, now seeing an EPS of $3.76 to $3.92 on sales growth of 2% to 4%, below current consensus estimates of $3.93. Shares -6.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen (NASDAQ:LAYN) announces preliminary Q4 results, saying it expects to log a...

    Layne Christensen (NASDAQ:LAYN) announces preliminary Q4 results, saying it expects to log a surprise loss as the drilling-services provider said it will book steep losses in its heavy civil segment, driven by high costs from projects in the Northeast. It now sees its EPS coming in at a loss of $1.18 - 1.28 on sales of $230.0M, below the $273.23M Street estimate. Shares -3.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 PM
  • EVLV

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NQ +19%. VVTV +12%. SMTC +11%. INVN +4%. ANGI +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NQ +19%. VVTV +12%. SMTC +11%. INVN +4%. ANGI +4%.
    After-hours top losers: SCTY -11%. PETM -8%. CE -8%. VICL -7%. BSFT -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) reports February sales results, saying that total net sales for the...

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) reports February sales results, saying that total net sales for the four-week period ended March 2 increased 10.6% to $44.5M, compared to $40.2M for the prior year. Comparable store sales decreased 8.9%, compared to a 14.2% increase for the period ended February 2012. Shares -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (NASDAQ:ANGI) +3.7% AH after Piper starts coverage with an Outperform and $25 PT....

    Angie's List (NASDAQ:ANGI) +3.7% AH after Piper starts coverage with an Outperform and $25 PT. Shares of the local services reviews site have been on a roll this year, aided by a Q4 beat and strong Q1 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • KYN

    Kayne Anderson MLP (NYSE:KYN) -5.1% AH after announcing a public offering of 4M common...

    Kayne Anderson MLP (NYSE:KYN) -5.1% AH after announcing a public offering of 4M common shares. Net proceeds will be used to make additional portfolio investments KYN says is consistent with its investment objective and policies and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • SMTC

    Semtech (NASDAQ:SMTC): Q4 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $151M (+45% Y/Y) beats by...

    Semtech (NASDAQ:SMTC): Q4 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $151M (+45% Y/Y) beats by $1.88M. Shares +3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • DRYS

    More on DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q4 misses across the board, as the shipper was hit by costs...

    More on DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS): Q4 misses across the board, as the shipper was hit by costs associated with its 10-year class survey for the Eirik Raude, plus losses on its sale of the newbuilding tankers Esperona and Blanca. Looking forward, CEO George Economou comments that the short-term performance of the shipping markets remains bearish, as both tanker and drybulk spot charter rates continue to hover around historic lows. (Conference Call Webcast). Shares -4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • EVLV

    Value Vision Media (VVTV): Q4 EPS of -$0.23 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $177.5M (+20.3% Y/Y)...

    Value Vision Media (VVTV): Q4 EPS of -$0.23 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $177.5M (+20.3% Y/Y) beats by $15.67M. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity (SCTY): Q4 EPS of -$1.10 misses by $0.66. Revenue of $25.3M misses by $11M. Shares...

    SolarCity (SCTY): Q4 EPS of -$1.10 misses by $0.66. Revenue of $25.3M misses by $11M. Shares -7.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • SNOA

    Oculus Innovative Sciences (OCLS) announces a public stock offering. It intends to use the net...

    Oculus Innovative Sciences (OCLS) announces a public stock offering. It intends to use the net proceeds for the repayment of debt and to retire a portion of common stock previously issued to its lenders. The size and terms of the offering haven't been disclosed. Aegis Capital is acting as sole book-running manager. Shares -7.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • PETM

    PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM): Q4 EPS of $1.24 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.88B (+15% Y/Y) misses by...

    PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM): Q4 EPS of $1.24 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.88B (+15% Y/Y) misses by $0.01B. Shares -5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • BB

    Positive comments from Thorsten Heins contributed to BlackBerry's (BBRY +6.1%) rebound today. In...

    Positive comments from Thorsten Heins contributed to BlackBerry's (BBRY +6.1%) rebound today. In an interview with Spain's Expansión, Heins suggested the Z10 has seen strong interest from users of rival platforms. The comments come a few days after a BGR report stated 1/2 of Canadian Z10 sales, and 1/3 of U.K. sales, involve converts. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 10 Comments
  • JCI

    Johnson Controls (JCI +1.9%) pares back gains after the company denies earlier reports that it...

    Johnson Controls (JCI +1.9%) pares back gains after the company denies earlier reports that it might sell its automotive interiors business, saying it has no current intention to divest this segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • RGLD

    Does the surge in gold mining stocks mean the bottom is in? Gold futures finish flat after a...

    Does the surge in gold mining stocks mean the bottom is in? Gold futures finish flat after a two-day climb, but the big story in recent sessions hasn't been the physical gold as much as the miners. The mining ETF (GDX +3.9%) is surging nearly 4% today, but that's after a ~20% YTD selloff. Today, miners are broadly higher: RGLD +4.5%, AEM +4.3%, ABX +3.9%, KGC +3.8%, GG +4.1%, NEM +3.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 21 Comments
  • SGMO

    Sangamo BioSciences (SGMO -8.3%) slides after presenting new data from its program to develop a...

    Sangamo BioSciences (SGMO -8.3%) slides after presenting new data from its program to develop a functional cure for HIV/AIDS in two presentations at the 20th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections. SGMO expects to present preliminary data in the first half of 2013 and the full data set from both trials by the end of 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSKN

    Mela Sciences (MELA -17%) reverses yesterday's post-session gains and sinks on a disappointing...

    Mela Sciences (MELA -17%) reverses yesterday's post-session gains and sinks on a disappointing Q4. Higher marketing expenses, coupled with an increase in costs associated with installing its Melafinds systems in medical offices, all conspired to pressure margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • JCI

    Johnson Controls (JCI +6%) moves higher - making it one of the top performers in the S&P 500...

    Johnson Controls (JCI +6%) moves higher - making it one of the top performers in the S&P 500 - on reports that the company may sell its automotive interiors unit. A sale of the unit, which has struggled with margin pressures, low vehicle production in Europe and increased competition in China, would still leave the company with three major businesses: automotive seating, building controls and car batteries.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Carl Icahn has taken a 6% stake in Dell (DELL-OLD +0.9%), CNBC reports. Shares have jumped to...

    Carl Icahn has taken a 6% stake in Dell (DELL-OLD +0.9%), CNBC reports. Shares have jumped to $14.25 on the news, putting them 4.4% above Dell's $13.65/share LBO price. If the report is true, Southeastern Asset and other shareholders fighting for a higher bid just got themselves a big ally. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • END

    Shares of Endeavour International (END +26.7%) are soaring after reporting a narrower Q4 loss as...

    Shares of Endeavour International (END +26.7%) are soaring after reporting a narrower Q4 loss as sales revenue surged nearly six-fold to $97.6M from $16.6M; analysts had expected ~$84M. Sales volumes more than doubled to ~11.5K boe/day as average prices also more than doubled to $91.94/boe. Oil represented 54% of total proved reserves at year-end 2012 vs. 18% a year ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power Systems (BLDP +71.3%) signs a four-year engineering services contract with...

    Ballard Power Systems (BLDP +71.3%) signs a four-year engineering services contract with Volkswagen (VLKAY.PK, OTCPK:VLKAF) to develop fuel cells for use in powering demonstration cars in VW's fuel cell automotive research program. BLDP says the expected contract value is C$60M-C$100M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • FONR

    Fonar (FONR +5.2%) gains today on news that one of its units has acquired a business managing 12...

    Fonar (FONR +5.2%) gains today on news that one of its units has acquired a business managing 12 stand-up MRI and centers and other scanning facilities in Florida and New York for $34.4M. This makes the image device maker the country's largest network of such standup facilities. The new company will be known as Health Diagnostics Management.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZUMZ

    A number of retailers are feeling the heat after American Eagles Outfitters reports a rough...

    A number of retailers are feeling the heat after American Eagles Outfitters reports a rough start to 2013. Though the retailer blamed weather for its downbeat outlook for the current quarter, retail analysts can't help but wonder if teenager clothing is falling on the wrong side of the discretionary vs. non-discretionary spending line. Decliners: ZUMZ -1.8%, ANF -1.0%, URBN -2.2%, ARO -2.4%, BKE -1.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • TRIP

    15% of TripAdvisor's (TRIP +3.7%) traffic now involves its hotel metasearch product, the company...

    15% of TripAdvisor's (TRIP +3.7%) traffic now involves its hotel metasearch product, the company discloses. Moreover, monetization is very strong, with ad click prices (CPCs) often well above those of alternative formats, and the company thinks prices can rise further as it drives more traffic to top keyword bidders. All of this leaves Deutsche confident TripAdvisor's growth can accelerate in 2013 and 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (PAY +10%) gets a relief rally, as reassuring comments from management and sell-side...

    VeriFone (PAY +10%) gets a relief rally, as reassuring comments from management and sell-side fans overshadow weak results and guidance expected following its warning. UBS, which thinks a turnaround can happen in 6-12 months, argues secular trends and VeriFone's competitive positioning remain solid. Goldman, however, sees VeriFone's troubles taking several quarters to resolve. Management mentioned on the earnings call it's ramping investments in product customization, and suggested it got ahead of itself in shifting to a services-focused business model.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • ZOLT

    Zoltek (ZOLT -2.3%) says it's turned down a request for a special shareholders meeting from its...

    Zoltek (ZOLT -2.3%) says it's turned down a request for a special shareholders meeting from its largest unaffiliated stakeholder, which is seeking to remove the current members of the manufacturer of carbon fibers' board.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • OSIR

    Midday top 10 gainers: OSIR +30%. END +27%. HCI +19%. PCYG +18%. MERU +17%. EGLE +14%. MHH +14%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: OSIR +30%. END +27%. HCI +19%. PCYG +18%. MERU +17%. EGLE +14%. MHH +14%. PRAN +13%. CYTR +13%. VGZ +13%.
    Midday top 10 losers: OSH -17%. SCKT -14%. OTC:ACUR -12%. OSBC -11%. AEO -11%. AVAV -10%. VSCI -10%. TFM -10%. MFB -10%. MOC -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • ACUR

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR -14%) gives back a chunk of Tuesday's 48% rise that followed the...

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR -14%) gives back a chunk of Tuesday's 48% rise that followed the drug-maker's announcement of a deal with the Kerr Drug store chain to carry the Nexafed, a decongestant that's designed to be very difficult converting into methamphetamine.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • WG

    Willbros Group (NYSE:WG): Q4 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $573M (+54% Y/Y) beats by...

    Willbros Group (NYSE:WG): Q4 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $573M (+54% Y/Y) beats by $87M. Sees FY 2013 revenue of $1.9B-$2.1B vs. consensus $2.1B. Releasing results at midday after some data was mistakenly released earlier. After a trading halt, shares +5.9%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (AVAV -14.5%) regains some of the losses from its post-session pummelling...

    AeroVironment (AVAV -14.5%) regains some of the losses from its post-session pummelling yesterday, but still remains firmly in the red after its FQ3 missed estimates hard. Net profit fell 33% Y/Y as the technology company suffered weaker sales across all business lines. The company also sharply cut its 2013 outlook, which Chief Executive Tim Conver attributed to delays in government procurement activities. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • EPL

    EPL Oil & Gas (EPL -2.5%) agrees to sell non-operated assets in Bay Marchand for...

    EPL Oil & Gas (EPL -2.5%) agrees to sell non-operated assets in Bay Marchand for $62.3M in cash and assumption of liabilities while retaining deep rights. EPL says the sale of the assets will have a minimal effect on 2013 forecast production of 17K-18.5K bbl/day or EBITAX of $475M-$525M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • Z

    Volatile/well-shorted Trulia (TRLA +7%) and Zillow (Z +4.3%) jump following the release of...

    Volatile/well-shorted Trulia (TRLA +7%) and Zillow (Z +4.3%) jump following the release of encouraging MBA Mortgage Applications data, which included a 15% Y/Y increase in the Purchase Index. Zillow is making new post-IPO highs, whereas Trulia remains 25% below its Feb. peak.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • POZN

    Pozen (POZN -1.7%) slips after its Q4 comes in slightly below Street expectations. In its...

    Pozen (POZN -1.7%) slips after its Q4 comes in slightly below Street expectations. In its earnings call, the company said it is preparing a new drug application for investigational products containing enteric-coated aspirin and immediate release omeprazole, including two dosage forms, PA32540 containing 325 mg of aspirin and PA8140, a low dose formulation containing 81 mg aspirin. It continues to expect filing for both products no later than Q2 FY13. (Conference Call Webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • PBR

    The increases in diesel prices made overnight and in January should add ~$3.6B to Petrobras'...

    The increases in diesel prices made overnight and in January should add ~$3.6B to Petrobras' (PBR +11.4%) bottom line in 2013, Credit Suisse estimates. Despite a likely deterioration in PBR's finances and expectations that crude oil output will remain stagnant this year, "we could be in front of a value opportunity to [PBR's] vast growth potential," the firm says. PBR.A +5.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY +4.2%) is bucking a downtrend that has led shares to fall 26% from Feb. 7 to...

    BlackBerry (BBRY +4.2%) is bucking a downtrend that has led shares to fall 26% from Feb. 7 to Tuesday's close. Yesterday, Pac Crest's James Faucette (previous) estimated the Z10 has grabbed 5%-8% of the U.K. smartphone market since its Feb. launch, while cautioning retailer inventories have risen as sell-through declines.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 8 Comments
  • SSW

    Seaspan (SSW +4.1%) is upgraded to Neutral from Underperform with a $21 target price (from $16)...

    Seaspan (SSW +4.1%) is upgraded to Neutral from Underperform with a $21 target price (from $16) at BofA, believing SSW is finally past the trough of the container shipping market overhang. The firm notes SSW's planned 25% dividend raise, improving cash flow as vessels remain under charter, and recently signed charters and contracts for sizeable vessels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • AMAG

    Amag Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +1.6%) says the supplemental new drug application for its Feraheme...

    Amag Pharmaceuticals (AMAG +1.6%) says the supplemental new drug application for its Feraheme Injection for Intravenous use has been accepted for review by the FDA. The application requests FDA approval to expand beyond the current indication for the treatment of iron deficiency anemia in adults with chronic kidney disease to adult patients who have failed or couldn't take oral iron treatment. The FDA has set October 21 as a target date for completion of their review.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY -2.9%) saw a slight growth slowdown in February, says Baird's Colin Sebastian in a...

    eBay (EBAY -2.9%) saw a slight growth slowdown in February, says Baird's Colin Sebastian in a report that seems to be pressuring shares. Baird's sales tracker (for Marketplaces transactions?) indicates growth fell to a low teens Y/Y rate in February from a mid/high-teens level in January. However, Sebastian maintains an Outperform and $60 PT, and is "comfortable" with a Q1 forecast for 12.5% Y/Y U.S. merchandise volume growth. (ChannelAdvisor)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARI

    Apollo Commercial Real Estate (ARI -2.7%) prices an 8M share secondary, with underwriters...

    Apollo Commercial Real Estate (ARI -2.7%) prices an 8M share secondary, with underwriters granted an option to purchase another 1.2M shares. Total float will rise to more than 37M shares if the option is exercised. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • CLDX

    Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +2.3%) moves up after being initiated by Leerink Swann with an...

    Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +2.3%) moves up after being initiated by Leerink Swann with an Outperform rating and a price target of $18 a share. Leerink cites the strength of the drug developer's portfolio, saying 6 wholly owned clinical-stage biologics assets make its breadth rare among small and mid-cap biotech companies. The coverage also comes just a day before the company is expected to announce plans for a late stage study of CDX-011, a treatment for metastatic breast cancer - which should be a key catalyst for the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 2 Comments
  • MLNX

    EZchip's (EZCH +3.8%) bookings remain solid and its risk/reward is compelling at current levels,...

    EZchip's (EZCH +3.8%) bookings remain solid and its risk/reward is compelling at current levels, declares Benchmark. That's helping shares recoup some of the huge post-earnings losses it saw last month, following a disclosure Huawei is working on an in-house network processor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • CYOU

    Some Chinese Internet stocks sell off after Qihoo sees a post-earnings drop and Sohu (SOHU...

    Some Chinese Internet stocks sell off after Qihoo sees a post-earnings drop and Sohu (SOHU -9.4%) denies reports it's thinking of going private. CYOU -6.8%. SINA -4.4%. YOKU -5.7%.  NTES -1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • OILT

    Oiltanking Partners (OILT +3.7%) plans to spend $44M to build a new vessel dock and upgrade...

    Oiltanking Partners (OILT +3.7%) plans to spend $44M to build a new vessel dock and upgrade existing facilities at its terminal on the Houston Ship Channel to meet demand for export of liquefied petroleum gas, and will provide vessel-based LPG import and export services on the Houston channel exclusively to Enterprise Products Partners (NYSE:EPD) through 2026.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 3 Comments
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +5.4%) gains this morning after Piper Jaffray initiated the...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +5.4%) gains this morning after Piper Jaffray initiated the shares with an Overweight rating and $2.50 price target. Piper says PPHM is advancing two cancer drug candidates that, combined with its hybrid business model, present an attractive risk-reward opportunity. Additionally, the negative press over its lead drug candidate bavituximab has created a potential entry point to pick up the shares at a discount.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • TIBX

    Tibco (TIBX +10.6%) soars following an upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. The firm had downgraded...

    Tibco (TIBX +10.6%) soars following an upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. The firm had downgraded Tibco to Neutral in December in response to its FQ4 warning. FQ1 results arrive on March 21. Informatica (INFA +1.6%) and Qlik (QLIK +2.3%) might be rising in sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • FXC

    The Bank of Canada holds policy steady, its benchmark lending rate remaining at 1%. The...

    The Bank of Canada holds policy steady, its benchmark lending rate remaining at 1%. The statement has a dovish tilt though, the bank saying "considerable monetary stimulus currently in place will likely remain appropriate for a period of time." The loonie (NYSEARCA:FXC) tumbles, -0.6% and buying $0.9678.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • STRN

    Sutron (STRN +9.7%) pops after saying it's acquired substantially all of the commercial and...

    Sutron (STRN +9.7%) pops after saying it's acquired substantially all of the commercial and operating assets of Sabio Instruments, a Texas-based manufacturer of products for both the ambient air quality and combustion efficiency monitoring industries, for an all-cash price of $1.2M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +3.3%) says it may double sales of copper concentrate to China in the next...

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +3.3%) says it may double sales of copper concentrate to China in the next three years to as much as 1M metric tons/year as mined production expands. China is expected to boost concentrate imports by 17% this year, soaking up some of the global growth in mine supply.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 2 Comments
  • OSIR

    Osiris Therapeutics (OSIR +30%) soars after the company easily beat the Street with a narrower...

    Osiris Therapeutics (OSIR +30%) soars after the company easily beat the Street with a narrower Q4 loss and better revenues. The company posted Q4 loss of $0.08 per share, versus the consensus for a $0.15 loss. Revenues were $3.1M, nearly a fourfold increase from the prior year, and better than analysts estimates of $2.91M. Gross margin also grew to 70% compared to 58% in Q411.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • QIHU

    Sell on the news: Qihoo (QIHU -6.9%) is now off sharply post-earnings, albeit still up from...

    Sell on the news: Qihoo (QIHU -6.9%) is now off sharply post-earnings, albeit still up from Friday's close. Jefferies has cut shares to Hold: while noting Qihoo's strong revenue guidance, the firm is worried about weak margin guidance and a marketing spend ramp. It's also cutting its 2013 search revenue forecast by 12% to $100M. On the earnings call, management stated its mobile monetization efforts will be focused on games rather than ads over the near-term, and declared its Mobile Assistant marketplace the most popular Android app store in China.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • SD

    Lee Cooperman raises his stake in SandRidge Energy (SD +2.3%) to 26.8M shares from 24M...

    Lee Cooperman raises his stake in SandRidge Energy (SD +2.3%) to 26.8M shares from 24M previously. Last night, TPG-Axon also disclosed an additional stake ahead of the March 15 deadline for the vote on TPG's motion to replace the board.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 7 Comments
  • IMBBY

    Tobacco stocks struggle after the U.K. is reported to be looking at adopting packaging laws...

    Tobacco stocks struggle after the U.K. is reported to be looking at adopting packaging laws similar to the measures Australia instituted last year. In London, Imperial Tobacco (ITYBY.PK) and British American Tobacco (BTI -1.5%) started the day off weak, while stateside Reynolds American (RAI -2.1%), Lorillard (LO -0.8%) and Altria (MO -0.1%) are underperforming.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 7 Comments
  • AEO

    Execs with American Eagle Outfitters (AEO -10.8%) are on the defensive on the firm's earning...

    Execs with American Eagle Outfitters (AEO -10.8%) are on the defensive on the firm's earning conference call as the retailer's Q4 comes in weaker than expected and it issues even softer guidance for Q1. Mall traffic doesn't look good this year so far and transactions are down at a mid single-digit pace. (webcast)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • MEOH

    Methanex (MEOH +2.1%) says it will boost operating capacity at its New Zealand operations by...

    Methanex (MEOH +2.1%) says it will boost operating capacity at its New Zealand operations by 700K metric tons to 2.2M by year's end after securing a new natural gas supply agreement, and will add capacity at the Motunui site by increasing distillation to add another 200K metric tons/year. The expected cost of the two projects is ~$65M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • PRAN

    Prana Biotechnology (NASDAQ:PRAN) surges 17% after saying that its PBT434 treatment for...

    Prana Biotechnology (NASDAQ:PRAN) surges 17% after saying that its PBT434 treatment for Parkinson's Disease helped bring "marked improvements in motor function and coordination" in three animal models. PBT434 lowers the accumulation of a key protein called alpha-synuclein, which damages the nerve cells of the substantia nigra part of the part of the brain, where movement is controlled. (PR) (See PBT2 trial)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • DFS

    Discover Financial (DFS +1.4%) is upgraded to Buy by Blair's Robert Napoli, arguing the 9.6 PE...

    Discover Financial (DFS +1.4%) is upgraded to Buy by Blair's Robert Napoli, arguing the 9.6 PE on 2015 EPS (2015?) gives little credit to the company's franchise value and "proven" management strength. Napoli says the shares deserve a 13 multiple, giving them 35-40% upside from here.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM
